Package utils

Class PackUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.PackUtils
  • public class PackUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static methods for packing and unpacking some primitive types (char, int, long and double) and Strings (limiting their maximum length). The ordering of bytes has been chosen to be the same, when possible, to that used by classes java.io.DataOutput and java.io.DataInput.

      PackUtils()

        offset - the position in the array where the boolean is written

      • packShort

        public static void packShort​(short s,
                             byte[] buffer,
                             int offset)
        Writes a short in the two bytes starting at the given position of the given byte array. The short is laid out with the most significant byte first in the array.
        Parameters:
        s - the short to be written on the buffer beginning at position offset
        buffer - the byte array where the short is to be written
        offset - the starting position in the array where the short is written

      • unpackShort

        offset - the position in the array where the int is read
        Returns:
        the int that has been read

      • packLimitedString

        public static void packLimitedString​(java.lang.String str,
                                     int maxLength,
                                     byte[] buffer,
                                     int offset)
        Writes, al most, the first maxLenght characters of the String starting at the given position in the given array.
        Parameters:
        str - the string from wich the characters are read
        maxLength - the maximum number of characters to consider
        buffer - the byte array where the characters are written
        offset - the starting position in the array where the characters are written.

        Parameters:
        maxLength - the maximum number of characters to consider
        buffer - the byte array from where the characters are to be read
        offset - the starting position in the array from where the characters are read.
        Returns:
        the String that has been read.
